conflictDescription: User Story A wants ALFRED to offer help automatically when needed, but User Story B forbids health check-ins outside the home and only allows them when arranged by the user. These are opposite instructions on when and how ALFRED can offer help.
userStoryASummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to offer help automatically when needed, so I can stay healthy without losing control.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want health check-ins only at my home and arranged by me, so I feel safe and avoid hospitals.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to include user consent and location limits for automatic help, aligning with User Story B that prioritizes user control and home-only check-ins.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to offer help automatically at home with my permission, so I stay healthy and feel safe.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want health check-ins only at my home and arranged by me, so I feel safe and avoid hospitals.

conflictDescription: User Story A asks ALFRED to give reminders anytime without user control, while User Story B asks to allow reminders only when the user says, forbidding automatic reminders. These are opposite expectations for reminder activation.
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to give me reminders and support anytime so it can help me fully, even if I cannot control the timing.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to turn on medication reminders only when I say, so I do not get unwanted alerts and keep full control.
resolutionDescription: Both stories are updated to allow reminders with user control: reminders can be automatic but only when allowed by the user, balancing help and control.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to give me reminders automatically only when I allow, so I get help without losing control.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to enable medication reminders when I say, so I avoid unwanted alerts and keep control.
